objects.name: FSB
objects.description:
The **Federal Security Service** of the [Russian Federation](/intelligence/objects/location--1175a3bd-dd53-4a7e-9cdd-50743079025a) (**FSB**), known as the Federalnaya Sluzhba Bezopasnosti in Russian, is one of the main intelligence agencies and the **successor of the Soviet Union’s KGB**. Its missions are to insure **counter-intelligence**, **internal** and **border security**, **counter-terrorism**, and **surveillance** as well as investigating some other types of serious crimes and federal law violations. The Federal Security Service is **accountable of the regime’s political stability**, which includes to fight “against terrorism and extremism” — meaning, in facts, against **all those who could challenge the regime**; to monitor the political opposition; to survey the borders; and even to manage part of the intelligence activities. Thus, even if the FSB does not explicitly have foreign or military intelligence objectives, it seems that this institution does conduct such operations. For fact, in the recent Russian invasion of Ukraine, media reported FSB top operatives being fired for misjudging the Ukrainian defense capacities. The FSB has 150,000 employees, plus 200,000 in charge of border control. The FSB is also the **main agency that regulates laws with the aim of reaching technological independence and information control in a Russian pseudo-closed internet (RUNET)**. In March 2018, the **FSB asked for Telegram’s encryption keys**, a Russian messaging service that provides end-to-end encrypted communications. Facing Telegram rejection, the media surveillance administration Roskomnadzor threatened to shut down Telegram in Russia. The blocking led to interruptions of many third-party Russian services, but practically did not affect the availability of Telegram in Russia and was officially unblocked on June 19, 2020. In opposition to the APTs working under the military intelligence service GRU, the APTs linked to the FSB (such as [Turla](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--124a5f78-1a1c-47b4-8c9a-979b5599852d), [Dragonfly](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--003b5bbc-38bc-4591-9f62-54f58e7248d2), [DragonFly 2.0](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--d53a0de7-72a3-4410-8e4a-1ffef7cd519a), [Garmaredon](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--e307cf3d-f51d-4f2c-bbc3-b5b90cec9bdd)) **focus more on targeted and strategic cyber espionage**, internally and internationally, **than destructive operations** (prepositioning and actual cyber sabotage). Moreover, the FSB is **allegedly the main point of contact for Russian-aligned cybercrime groups**, such as the Conti ransomware group (more details below). The FSB is known to have conducted a multi-stage campaign operations, between at least 2011 to 2018, in which they gained remote access to U.S. and international **Energy Sector** networks, deployed **ICS-focused malware**, and collected and exfiltrated enterprise and ICS-related data. # FSB Cyber Unit and APTs linked
* **Center 16** aka Military **Unit 71330** aka Special Communications Service of Russia
Center 16 **operates** [**Dragonfly**](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--003b5bbc-38bc-4591-9f62-54f58e7248d2) (aka Energetic Bear aka Berserk Bear) **and** [**DragonFly 2.0**](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--d53a0de7-72a3-4410-8e4a-1ffef7cd519a). There is debate over the extent of overlap between Dragonfly 2.0 and Dragonfly, but there is sufficient evidence to lead to these being tracked as two separate groups). The Special Communications Service of Russia also called Center 16 is a **signal Intelligence (SIGINT) unit** which can collect radio, satellite, mobile phone, and data communications. Center 16 is **hypothetically the main offensive capability** of the FSB according to some observers. * **Center 18** aka Military **Unit 64829** aka Information Security Center (TsIB)
Center 18 **operates** [**Gamaredon**](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--e307cf3d-f51d-4f2c-bbc3-b5b90cec9bdd) (aka ACTINIUM aka Armageddon), [**TURLA**](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--124a5f78-1a1c-47b4-8c9a-979b5599852d) (aka Venomous Bear) **and** [**Calisto**](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--a4a994d1-95e4-4046-8930-ff3d2cd985ea). TURLA is alledgly operated in coordination with Center 16 for the SIGINT capabilities. The Center for Information Security (TsIB) seems to be an more **defensive** and **targeted espionage unit** of the FSB according to open-source publications. This is in line with **Garmagedon and Turla’s espionage-driven operations** when DragonFly (offensive center 16) includes destructive operations. Center 18 alledgly operates the System for Operative Investigative Activities (**SORM**), a technical solution for lawful **telecommunications interception** operating in Russia. On 7 Dec 2023, a [joint attribution](https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/star-blizzard-continues-spear-phishing-campaigns) from the US, UK and 5Eyes assessed Calisto is almost certainly subordinate to the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) Centre 18. ![](https://app.sekoia.io/api/v2/inthreat/images/b9645ad13412fcb8701240fda9844c6ef9f99bdbebd8486d0555fb9b1b36c92f.png)

objects.name: Mallx
objects.description:
Sekoia.io analysts are aware of a threat actor calling itself `Mallx` that recruits affiliates ("pentesters") for the [Mallox ransomware operation](/intelligence/objects/malware--ce7a3bf8-fae6-4ab1-97b8-51c55cea556e) on underground forums since at least late January 2023. It declares owning a C++ ransomware for rent and proposes a web panel with price adjustment for victims and chat rooms, and support services to affiliates.

It is likely that `Mallx` manages the Mallox RaaS program and splits the ransom 80/20 with affiliates.

`Mallx` writes its posts in both Russian and English and operates on the RAMP cybercrime forum since November 12, 2022:
* Threat actor's profile on the RAMP forum: hxxp://rampjcdlqvgkoz5oywutpo6ggl7g6tvddysustfl6qzhr5osr24xxqqd[.]onion/members/mallx.3202/
* Threat actor's publication about the Mallox RaaS program: hxxp://rampjcdlqvgkoz5oywutpo6ggl7g6tvddysustfl6qzhr5osr24xxqqd[.]onion/threads/%D0%9A%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BF%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BA%D0%B5%D1%80-mallox-%D0%B8%D1%89%D0%B5%D1%82-%D0%BF%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2-%D0%B2-%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B4%D1%83.888/

![](https://app.sekoia.io/api/v2/inthreat/images/025cac15ae9d5bbfcb00455a9e54785109796e56c78c74837c5ce09afc49bd53.png)
Figure: `Mallx` publication on the RAMP forum (SEKOIA.IO, february 2023)

`Mallx` shares the following contact information:
* Jabber ID: mallox@]exploit.]im
* TOX ID: 87F021ADD4DD69217D3D5BB3B42DAB52F362D8ABE2A831CFE381D3C72BB0AC0341B3387C14C4

SEKOIA.IO also uncovered a second online persona advertising the Mallox RaaS program on multiple cybercrime forums which goes by the moniker `**RansomR**`. It `RansomR` operates on cybercrime forums since at least May 2022  Itcommunicates in both Russian and English depending on the forum. `RansomR`'s activities on cybercrime forums consist of recruiting partners and sharing stolen data from victims.

![](https://app.sekoia.io/api/v2/inthreat/images/c5f8c5ce073ab859afc9152d7650ba0792af9995438300544d7051074f48e3a2.png)
Figure:  `RansomR` recruiting partners on the Nulled.to forum (SEKOIA.IO, February 2023)

Here are some forum posts made by `RansomR` between late January and early February 2023 to recruit affiliates ("pentesters") for its ransomware operation:
* hxxp://breached65xqh64s7xbkvqgg7bmj4nj7656hcb7x4g42x753r7zmejqd.onion/Thread-Ransomware-staff-recruitment
* hxxps://bdfclub[.]com/threads/nabor-v-komandu-pentestinga.153204/
* hxxps://nulled[.]to/topic/1474903-ransomware-staff-recruitment/
* hxxps://cpamafia[.]pro/threads/nabor-v-komandu-pentestinga.10477/

`RansomR` shares the following contact information:
* Telegram account: hxxps://t.]me/ma11ox
* Jabber ID: Some@]exploit.]im
* TOX ID: C3807932EC298049310277C45EC059CDF08BBA566C4B9E33F0B5E0D0ACC64C3406E79DD2441E

SEKOIA.IO is not able to confirm any direct link between the `RansomR` and `Mallx` threat actors. It is possible that  `RansomR` and `Mallx` are the same person or two different individuals sharing the role of administrator of the Mallox RaaS program.

objects.name: GRU
objects.description:
The **General Staff of the Armed Forces** of the Russian Federation (Glavnoye Razvedyvatelnoye Upravlenie) is a military intelligence service which aim is to provide intelligence to the Ministry of Defense, the military leadership and Russian armed forces as a whole. This institution has been **reformed in 2010** and presents now a new acronym, **GU**, but is **still widely known under the GRU acronym** that we use in this description. Unlike Russia's other security and intelligence agencies such as the FSB and the SVR, which report to the president of the Russian Federation, the **head of the GRU is subordinate to the Russian military command**, reporting to the Minister of Defense. The Main Directorate controls the military intelligence service and maintains its own Special Forces units known as Spetsnaz. Although its missions are supposed to focus on intelligence collection to support military decision-making, the **GRU is in fact Russia's largest foreign-intelligence agency** conducting covert operations to **support foreign policy objectives**. Since 2004, the GRU has **developed significant cyber capabilities**, mixing it with its historical experience in conducting **psychological and information operations** inherited from the Soviet propaganda era. Russian military doctrine now includes a **new view of warfare** where the line between peace and conflict is blurred. In order to exploit this situation, the GRU considers that non-violent tools are important, thus **cyber operations as an effective and cheap tool** to **undermine, subvert, and manipulate** an adversary. This doctrine is the reason why, among classic espionage purposes, cyber operations detected from **GRU subgroups show deception, manipulation and sabotage objectives** when the FSB and the SVR operations are more silent and covert spying-oriented cyber operations. In line with the Russian government goals, the GRU seeks to manipulate domestic audiences and **undermine faith in democratic systems of government**. For example, in the context of the 2016 US presidential election, the Democratic National Committee (DNC) has been targeted in order to leak information with the purpose of undermining candidate Clinton. A GRU's operation has been exposed targeting the 2017 French presidential election where operatives leaked information from Macron’s EM! party. Instead of seeking a particular candidate (as it was assumed for Trump), **the goal for Russian information operations focuses more on causing chaos and weakening the domestic legitimacy** of an adversary’s government.
![](https://app.sekoia.io/api/v2/inthreat/images/b9645ad13412fcb8701240fda9844c6ef9f99bdbebd8486d0555fb9b1b36c92f.png) ### GRU Cyber Units and APTs
* **Unit 26165** aka 85th Main Special Service Center Unit 26165 **operates the intrusion set [APT 28](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--40479e35-a7ca-4c05-998d-2cf21ab751cc)** (aka Fancy Bear aka Sofacy). Unit 26165 is a **SIGINT unit** that collects information for various customers, including other GRU units responsible for covert operations. The unit, which is also known as the GRU 85 Main Special Service Center, is located at 20 Komsomolskiy Prospekt, Moscow. Unit 26165 conducted the **operation to exfiltrate emails** associated with **Hillary Clinton**’s presidential election campaign and the Democratic National Committee in 2016, **then gave it to Unit 74455 to organize the DCLeaks campaign** in parallel to the creation of Guccifer 2.0 avatar. The GRU officers arrested in the Netherlands while conducting a close access operation against the OPCW network were also from Unit 26165. * **Unit 74455** aka Main Center for Special Technologies (GTsST) Unit 74455 **operates the intrusion set [Sandworm](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--f29bd8cc-1cea-497c-ac3f-8d590b95c9d6)** (aka Telebots aka IRIDIUM). Unit 74455 appears to be a recent unit created to help support and expand the GRU’s cyber operation and information warfare. Unit 74455, is also known as the Main Center for Special Technologies, and is commonly referred to by media reports and the U.S. government as Sandworm. Located in the Moscow suburbs, Unit 74455 is suspected to have built and manipulated the **Guccifer 2.0 avatar** used to leak information from the **2016 DNC hack**. This unit is **specialized into hybrid, destructive and destabilization operations** such as the MacronLeaks, the 2017 NotPetya attack or the Industroyer campaigns against the Ukrainian power grid. * **Unit 54777** aka 72nd Special Service Center The Special Service Center is reportedly responsible for the **GRU’s psychological operations** that maintain front organizations, including **InfoRos** and the Institute of the Russian Diaspora. InfoRos was named in the 2021 US sanctions as an **organization that spreads false conspiracy narratives** and disinformation promoted by GRU officials (COVID-19 spreading through OTAN soldiers disinformation campaigns). According to open-source publications, GRU’s InfoRos has registered about 1,300 online « news websites » including in the domestic web (attached to cities, towns, districts, or even villages) in order to amplify that broadcast the Russian government’s narrative. **There is no known intrusion set linked to this unit**. * **Unknown GRU unit** Not enough technical clues or open-sources publications attribute **the intrusion set [Ember Bear](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--545e1e88-42d7-43ec-816e-0702bef0dacd)** (aka Lorec53 aka UAC-0056) to a specific GRU unit. Howerver, according to Crowdstrike, **Ember Bear TTPs are consistent with other GRU cyber operations**. This group has operated against government and military organizations in Eastern Europe since early 2021, likely to **collect intelligence** from target networks. Crowdstrike attributes the WhisperGate sabotage campaign to Ember Bear with moderate confidence. On January 31, 2022, CERT-UA publicly attributed to Ember Bear an attack targeting an energy organization in Ukraine. * The **Central Scientific Institute of Chemistry and Mechanics** This institution, which is a research organization part of the Russian Ministry of Defence, but is not under direct GRU administration, **operates the intrustion set [XENOTIME](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--7b3fddaf-ee4d-4009-bd04-fccfdbeeee43)** (aka TEMP.Veles aka Triton). XENOTIME operators associated with the Institute have **developed destructive ICS malware** known as **Triton** (also called HatMan and TRISIS) which has been exposed and sanctioned by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth, and Development Office (FCDO) for a 2017 incident that involved safety override controls in a foreign oil refinery. ### GRU’s most exposed cyber operations (not exclusive)
* **CyberBerkut ([APT 28](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--40479e35-a7ca-4c05-998d-2cf21ab751cc))** – During the 2014 Ukrainian presidential election, a series of malicious activities against Kyiv electoral institutions - including destructive operations, data leak and DDoS attack, where performed under the CyberBerkut avatar, in an attempt to undermine and/or influence election resultats. * **TV5 Monde (APT28)** – A 2015 false flag destructive cyberattack that shut down every broadcast channel of the French international TV network while diffusing fake Islamic State propaganda. The attack was conducted by APT28 in retaliation from the French position on the 2014 Crimean Invasion and for the delivery cancellation of two French Mistral-class helicopter carriers ordered in 2010 by Russia. * **Ukraine power grid hack ([Sandworm](/intelligence/objects/intrusion-set--f29bd8cc-1cea-497c-ac3f-8d590b95c9d6))** – December 2015 destructive attacks on Ukraine’s electrical infrastructure, Ministry of Finance, and State Treasury Service. * **DCLeaks (APT28 and Sandworm)** – During the 2016 US presidential election, APT28 and Sandworm targeted DNC’s email network (among other targets such as voting machines), and dumped emails from Democratic Party leaders. The leak was orchestrated with the creation of Guccifer 2.0 and DCLeaks websites in order to mess with the election and undermine US institutions. * **MacronLeaks (APT28 and Sandworm)** – 2017 hack-and-leak operation targeting French President Emmanuel Macron’s emails and interference in France’s presidential election. * **[NotPetya](/intelligence/objects/campaign--595f55b5-0e99-412b-9a0c-5a5cecd9cd2d) ransomware (Sandworm)** – 2017 ransomware attack initially targeting Ukraine but which infected computers globally and caused an estimated $10 billion in damage. * **[Olympic Destroyer](/intelligence/objects/campaign--c7bb8f6b-0092-49a7-8b88-d356c0ef61ff) (Sandworm)** – 2018 false flag destructive cyber operation against the PyeongChang Winter Olympics in South Korea. Operators tried to disguise themselves as North Korean operatives by using known TTPs attributed to the Lazarus intrusion set. * **OPCW close access operation (Sandworm)** – In 2018, in a global cyber offensive campaign against UK and European institutions, GRU officers have been arrested in the Netherlands trying to access the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons investigating the nerve agent attack against Sergei Skripal.
